channel.title: Comments on: My Air Conditioner Failed – So this week it is personal

item.title: By: DougNic
item.dc:creator: DougNic
item.description:
In reply to <a href="/censys/blog/burning-reduction-methods/my-air-conditioner-failed-so-this-week-it-is-personal/comment-page-1/#comment-17051">Bill Carroll</a>.
i know that you replied 2 years ago and i do not know if this will get to you but thanks so much for your comments...i did not know that people could comment without my approval or even my notification...so thanks again for your very good points...
item.content:encoded:
In reply to Bill Carroll.

i know that you replied 2 years ago and i do not know if this will get to you but thanks so much for your comments…i did not know that people could comment without my approval or even my notification…so thanks again for your very good points…

item.title: By: Bill Carroll
item.dc:creator: Bill Carroll
item.description: The question is, why didn't the service tech not try and locate the leak. If in your coils, a new unit is probably in the works. At 26 yo, the unit is past its life cycle and getting major replacement parts is pretty much out of the question.
item.content:encoded: The question is, why didn’t the service tech not try and locate the leak. If in your coils, a new unit is probably in the works. At 26 yo, the unit is past its life cycle and getting major replacement parts is pretty much out of the question.
